Description: The Jovo Node.js Framework assists in building cross-platform Voice Apps for Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant.

NativeScript, by Progress Software, allows you to build cross-platform, native iOS and Android apps without web views. You can use Angular, TypeScript or modern JavaScript to get truly native UI and performance while reusing the skills and the code from your web projects. Get 100% access to native APIs via JavaScript and reuse of packages from npm, CocoaPods and Gradle. Open source and backed by Progress. NativeScript is designed to give you significant code reuse between your web and mobile tiers and gives you direct access to every native platform API.
NativeScript is free and is open source.
The SpriteJS Framework allows creating sprites for animation and video games. Tested on WebKit, Firefox, Android phones, Opera and IE9.
The ZURB Foundation JS Framework aims to design responsive websites, applications, and emails. It provides semantic, readable, flexible, and customizable features.

The Bootstrap JS Framework helps to build responsive mobile sites, thinking in scalable CSS format. The Bootstrap team invites developers to write and maintain vanilla JavaScript plugins and improving tooling processes for frontend code.
The Aegis Go Framework is a serverless Golang deploy tool and framework for AWS Lambda. See original article at https://serifandsemaphore.io/build-a-serverless-api-in-seconds-with-go-c504398d86f6

Graphcool is an open-source backend development framework to develop and deploy production-ready GraphQL microservices. With Graphcool you can design your data model and have a production ready GraphQL API online in minutes.
The framework integrates with cloud-native serverless functions and is compatible with existing libraries and tools like GraphQL.js and Apollo Server. The framework offers an opinionated backend setup, including GraphQL database mapping, subscriptions & permission system. Graphcool comes with a CLI and a Docker-based runtime which can be deployed to any server or cloud.
The Baliba PHP Framework uses arrays, aiming to simplify API documentation writing. Instructions available in English and Haitian Creole.
The Orienteer Java Framework is an open source business application platform with flexible and dynamically configurable APIs.

The Fanout.io Python Framework is a hybrid reverse proxy and message broker, pushing data to connected devices. Open technology runs Fanout in the cloud and servers. Developers will work with Python, C, and C++ languages by using Fanout.

The gSOAP C++ Framework is a toolkit of portable C and C++ software to develop XML Web services with powerful type-safe XML data bindings. Easy-to-use code-generator tools allow to directly integrate XML data in C and C++. Serializes native application data in XML. Includes WSDL/XSD schema binding and auto-coding tools, stub/skeleton compiler. Offers robust Web server integration with Apache module and IIS extension. High-performance with XML pull parsing with schema validation. Supports XML SOAP and REST protocols, fast MIME/MTOM streaming, WS-Security, WS-Policy, WS-Discovery, WS-ReliableMessaging, WS-Addressing, XML-RPC and JSON.
iOS Framework and Android Library to send logs to the Bugfender cloud storage with a single API call.
The Jersey Framework aims to simplify RESTful services and client developments. With Jersey developers can track JAX-RS APIs using Java and Java Virtual Machine.
The WavesDevKit JavaScript Framework supports interaction with the Waves Platform. Use the framework’s Javascript platform to create transactions and access crucial Waves functions.

The ASP.Net Boilerplate Framework assists to develop web application targeting localization services. Developers can build on Microsoft Studio, .NET Core, Entity, Angular, Bootstrap, Swagger, NPM, and jQuery. The framework includes an API in XML and JSON formats and sample code. To learn more, visit https://aspnetboilerplate.com/Pages/Documents/Localization
The i18next Framework written in JavaScript provides internationalization, localization, and translation features. Plugins allow detecting languages, load translations, cache translations.

A-Frame Virtual Reality JavaScript Framework allows you to build virtual reality (VR) experiences. Mozilla is credited for introducing A-Frame as a simple but powerful solution for developing VR content. The framework’s documentation provides various examples of its usage.
The Sibers PHP Framework helps to create API projects, allowing developers to design data models, interact with a REST API, and use JSON-LD, Hydra, HAL, YAML, JSON, XML and CSV as formats.

The Uber LumaGL JavaScript Framework is a browser-based data visualization solution. Its lumaGL-provided building blocks are equipped with the user-friendly webGL2 feature for enhancing data visualizations and computations on browsers.

The MUI Material Design CSS Framework is a lightweight builder platform that prescribes to Google’s Material Design guidelines. Its fast, small, and user friendly design guarantees quality results. It features small footprint (mui.min.css – 66K, mui.min), responsive grid for implementing mobile-friendly sites, and customizable CSS library as well as JS and email libraries. The framework supports the onwards of IE10, iOS 6, and latest Chrome, Firefox, and Safari browsers.
The Grd Flexbox CSS Framework by Shogo Sensui allows you to create CSS applications using Flexbox.
The lightweight Mobi Mobile CSS Framework provides a flexible platform for building web applications.
The Milligram CSS Framework supports the development of design applications. Its design simplifies style setups and expedites app development.

The Spectre CSS Framework by Yan Zhu provides a simple platform for implementing CSS design concepts. The framework features modern base styles and responsive layout system as well as CSS components and utilities. Install the framework manually or deploy it using npm, Yarn, or Bower.
The Strapi NodeJS Content Management Framework simplifies the development of powerful CMS APIs. The framework features headless-CMS.
The Intercellular Cell JavaScript Framework is self-constructing web application. It is powered by a self-driving DOM.

The Nozzle React-Static JavaScript Framework allows you to construct applications using the React platform. The framework supports the development of static-progressive websites and react applications. Use the framework to interact with different platforms of the React ecosystem including CSS-in-JS libraries, GraphQL, and Redux.

Use the Yoctol Bottender JavaScript Framework to develop cross-platform bots for Slack, Messenger, LINE, and other platforms. The framework is written in ES6 and ES7 syntax and provides support for async await function.
